intro: Convolvulus arvensis var. volubilis, commonly known as field bindweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a robust root system that allows it to spread aggressively through both seeds and rhizomes. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Due to its invasive nature, it is considered a noxious weed in many regions.
